availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, medical student. Kentucky native. Son of Jane Mulholland. Medical student in Hardin County in 1860. Mustered into service as a surgeon in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) on March 31, 1862. Resigned April 11, 1863. Mustered into service as a surgeon in the First Regiment Capital Guards on July 21, 1864. Resigned on November 22, 1864.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Northern District, p. 306. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, District no. 3, p. 91. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 108. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 754. Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0056. Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport â€“ Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Roll #7007128, Louisville Deaths, books 7 and 8, p. 123.
